name: Art and Design

accreditedBody.name: Cornwall School Centred Initial Teacher Training. (Cornwall SCITT)

degreeSubjectRequirements: Your degree subject should have some relevance to the subject you wish to teach for Secondary. Any discipline is acceptable for Primary.
additionalGcseEquivalencies: These are completed in partnership with Cornwall SCITT who can provide further details.
aboutCourse:
We run our course in partnership with Cornwall SCITT. You can access information about the course structure from their website. Our trainees follow the same course structure as they do. It gives an overview of the training year, how trainees are assessed, the PGCE expectations and much more. For each Secondary subject there are subject based training days with a specialist teacher. This is usually based in a school. 

Cornwall SCITT
(https://www.cornwallscitt.org/)

Mounts Bay as the main placement has a strong Art and Design focus. We have had trainees with a number of degree subjects - photography, fine art etc. We develop your strengths and focus on gaps in knowledge and experience. We are very successful as a Creative school and there are plenty of opportunities to share your skills and knowledge.
interviewProcess: We have an interview process which we agree with our ITT Provider. We always have a formal interview with a Panel. We try where possible to include a short teaching episode in one of our partner schools for Primary and Mounts Bay for Secondary candidates. We include a tour at this time so you can see how school life is in practice.
howSchoolPlacementsWork:
Secondary - we use Mounts Bay Academy as the main placement school - based in Penzance. The website link for scitt also details the placement info.

There are very good transport links to and from the town and many people also car-share. Trainees quite often rent rooms or airbnb during the placements. We are 11-16. 

We provide our Secondary trainees with a Macbook and an iPad as this is an essential part of our teaching and learning. We work with Cornwall SCITT to choose a suitable second placement school.
